contextId.information: Luke introduces Gamaliel and provides background information about him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]] and  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, who was honored by all the people

contextId.information: This introduces Aeneas as a new character in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
This introduces a new person in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
Here "A certain woman" introduces a new person in the story. AT: "There was a woman named Lydia" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
The phrase "a certain" introduces a new person to the story. AT: "there was a young woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
Here the phrase "a certain" indicates this is introducing new person in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
The phrase "a certain" indicates that Luke is introducing a new person in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
The use of the words "a certain" introduces a new person in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
